data: ORTHO/GYN/TRAUMA/IR Patient Controlled Analgesia (PCA) (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Restricted to Department of Orthopaedic, Orthopaedic Trauma, Gynecology and Interventional Radiology Service only
Do not order from this order set if patient has received intrathecal or epidural opioid
Patient Care
Monitoring Orders are for Inpatient Ward
Vital Signs
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
Pulse Oximetry
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
Sedation Assessment
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q2h for 24 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
Sedation Assessment
If Sedation Score (POSS) 3 or greater:
Pain Assessment
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q2h for 24 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
Respiratory Rate
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q2h for 24 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
Respiratory Rate
If Respiratory Rate is 8/min or less:
Conditional Order - Ongoing
If/when Sedation Score (POSS) 3 AND respiratory rate greater than 8/min, then Hold PCA until POSS 2 or less
Conditional Order - Ongoing
If/when Sedation Score (POSS) 3 or greater AND respiratory rate equal to or less than 8/min, then Hold PCA and give naloxone
For patients at risk for increased respiratory depression (e.g. severe OSA):
Respiratory Rate
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 24 hour, then q4h
Sedation Assessment
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 24 hour, then q4h
Following Clinician / Provider Bolus Dose:
Respiratory Rate
q15min, for 30 minute, then PRN
Sedation Assessment
q15min for 30 minute, then PRN
Following increase in PCA Dose or decrease in lockout interval:
Respiratory Rate
q1h, for 2 hour, then PRN
Sedation Assessment
q1h for 2 hour, then PRN
Communication Order

Do NOT give any Opioids, CNS Depressants, and other analgesics unless approved by the Acute Pain Service (APS) / Perioperative Pain Service (POPS) / Anesthesiology (EXCEPT in Critical Care Units: CSICU and ICU)
Medications
Nurse to Discontinue Order Set/Phase [ANES]
Discontinue ORTHO/GYN/TRAUMA/IR Patient Controlled Analgesia (PCA) (Module) PowerPlan when patient is well managed on oral analgesics
PCA post intrathecal opioid order should be reduced for the first 18 hours post intrathecal then revert to PCA standard opioid order (orders are linked)
For use by Orthopaedic Service only
HYDROmorphone 0.6 mg/mL PCA- total volume
0.1 mg PCA dose, 12 min lockout interval, 0.1 mg PCA minimum dose, 0.2 mg PCA maximum dose, titrate instructions: titrate PCA dose as needed, pump type: Alaris, IV
0.2 mg PCA dose, 12 min lockout interval, 0.1 mg PCA minimum dose, 0.3 mg PCA maximum dose, titrate instructions: titrate PCA dose as needed, pump type: Alaris, IV

1 mg PCA dose, 12 min lockout interval, 0.5 mg PCA minimum dose, 1.5 mg PCA maximum dose, titrate instructions: titrate PCA dose as needed, pump type: Alaris, IV

3 mg PCA dose, 8 min lockout interval, 2 mg PCA minimum dose, 4 mg PCA maximum dose, titrate instructions: titrate PCA dose as needed, pump type: Alaris, IV

Simultaneous administration of other opioids, tranquilizers, hypnotics or sedatives via IV or other routes will have a synergistic effect causing increased sedation and respiratory depression
naloxone
0.1 mg, IV, q2min, PRN reverse opioid effect, drug form: inj
naloxone
0.1 mg, subcutaneous, q2min, PRN reverse opioid effect, drug form: inj
Respiratory
Oxygen Therapy
10 L/min if naloxone administered
Consults/Referrals
Anesthesia Pain Service Following
T;N
